doc.title: Lorem Ipsum
doc.chapter:
Two types of authentication are supported: BASIC AUTH and Session-based AUTH.
POST /api/login { "username" : <USERNAME_OR_EMAIL>, "password" : <PASSWORD> }
Header:
Set-Cookie:canopy-login-session=<COOKIE_VALUE>
Body:
{ "result" : "ok", "username" : <USERNAME> "email" : <EMAIL> }
POST /api/logout
{ "result" : "ok", }
To use BASIC AUTH, include the Base64-encoded "username:password" in every request. For example, if your username is "fry" and your password is "PlanetExpress", include the following header with your request:
Authorization: Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==
Canopy REST API requests can be made by both human users and IoT devices. When an IoT device is making the request:
The device's UUID is the username.
The device's Secret Key is the password.
For example:
For a device with:
- UUID: d5c827d2-1ba7-4da6-b87b-0864f0969fa8 - Secret Key: 00ae8a3ba42fa86765c885da90a7fcaec9898acb13fc2e00
You would:
Base64Encode("d5c827d2-1ba7-4da6-b87b-0864f0969fa8:00ae8a3ba42fa86765c885da90a7fcaec9898acb13fc2e00")
And then send this header:
Authorization: Basic ZDVjODI3ZDItMWJhNy00ZGE2LWI4N2ItMDg2NGYwOTY5ZmE4OjAwYWU4YTNiYTQyZmE4Njc2NWM4 ODVkYTkwYTdmY2FlYzk4OThhY2IxM2ZjMmUwMA==

chapter.title: Devices

section.title: Create Account-Linked Devices

chapter.section:
Some deployments of the Canopy Cloud Service allow devices to be created that are not associated with any User account. These are called "anonymous devices".
Each anonymous device has a user-assigned Secret Key that is used to restrict access.
Anonymous devices are automatically created by the /api/sync endpoint. When /api/sync encounters a new Device UUID in the BASIC AUTH header, it will create a new anonymous device.

section.title: List Devices
section.subsection:
To obtain a list of all devices the current Account has access to:
GET /api/me/devices

section.title: Get Single Device
section.subsection:
To obtain information about a single device:
GET /api/device/<UUID>
